tool.name: Null genotypes

param.name: title
param.help: Name for outputs from this job
param.label: Descriptive short name

param.name: ntotal
param.help: N total: total number of subjects
param.label: Create this total N subjects

param.name: ncases
param.help: N cases: Independent subjects with status set to 2. Set 0 for family data (NSubj/3 trios)
param.label: Total N Cases (0=generate family data - trios)

param.name: outFormat
param.label: Output format file type - linkage ped or fbat ped
param.option: fbat style - marker names in a header row

param.name: missingRate
param.help: Fraction of genotypes to be randomly set missing
param.label: Missing genotype call fraction

param.name: mendelRate
param.help: (family data) Fraction of apparently non-Mendelian transmission patterns
param.label: Mendel error transmission rate

param.name: missingValue
param.label: Missing value for an allele for the output ped file

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
This tool allows you to generate an arbitrary (sort of) synthetic genotype file (no attempt at LD - the markers are independent) with optional missingness, Mendel errors, minor allele frequency settings, family structure These might be used for testing under the null hypothesis of no association and are certainly useful for scale testing.
Note that although it runs reasonably fast given it's a script, generating a large data set takes a while. An hour or so should get you a reasonable (3GB) sized simulated null data set..
A better simulator can easily be swapped in with this tool interface.
-----
.. class:: warningmark
This tool is very experimental
.. class:: infomark
